sen.e: Tenrinjoo (universal ruler) (ideal king who reigns over the world not by armed force but by Buddhism) gave soldiers castles, clothes, treasures and so on according to feats they achieved.

sen.j: しかし髻(まげ、もとどり)の中にある宝珠だけは、みだりに与えると諸人が驚き怪しむので容易に人に授与しなかった。
sen.e: However, he did not recklessly grant sacred gem he held in his Mage/Motodori (hair bundled up on the top of the head) not to cause all people to be surprised and be suspicious.

sen.j: この物語の転輪聖王とは仏で、兵士たちは弟子、種々の手柄により与えられた宝とは爾前経（にぜんきょう＝法華経以前の様々な教え）、髻中の明珠とは法華経であることを表している。
sen.e: This story indicated that Tenrinjoo was Buddha, soldiers were disciples, treasures given according to various feats were Nizenkyo (various teachings before Hoke-kyo Sutra) and a brilliant gem in a king's top-knot was Hoke-kyo Sutra.

sen.j: ある所に腕の立つ良医がおり、彼には百人余りの子供がいた。
sen.e: At a certain place, there was an excellent physician with fine skill, who had 100-odd children.

sen.j: ある時、良医の留守中に子供たちが毒薬を飲んで苦しんでいた。
sen.e: One time, his children took poison and were suffering while the excellent physician was away.

sen.j: そこへ帰った良医は薬を調合して子供たちに与えたが、半数の子供たちは毒気が軽減だったのか父親の薬を素直に飲んで本心を取り戻した。
sen.e: The excellent physician returned home, compounded a medicine, which was given to the children, and half of the children, due probably to low toxicity, took without reservation the medicine their father prepared and recovered their conscience.

sen.j: しかし残りの子供たちはそれも毒だと思い飲もうとしなかった。
sen.e: However, the remaining children did not intend to take the medicine, which they thought was also poison.

sen.j: そこで良医は一計を案じ、いったん外出して使いの者を出し、父親が出先で死んだと告げさせた。
sen.e: Then, the excellent physician worked out a plan for him to leave home and make a messenger inform them that their father died on his trip.

sen.j: 父の死を聞いた子供たちは毒気も忘れ嘆き悲しみ、大いに憂いて、父親が残してくれた良薬を飲んで病を治すことができた。
sen.e: The children who heard about their father's death felt very sad and took the good medicine their father had left, which made them recovered.

sen.j: この物語の良医は仏で、病で苦しむ子供たちを衆生、良医が帰宅し病の子らを救う姿は仏が一切衆生を救う姿、良医が死んだというのは方便で涅槃したことを表している。
sen.e: This story indicated the excellent physician was Buddha, the children suffering from poisoning were Shujo, the excellent physician's return and rescue of suffering children was Buddha's rescue of Issai Shujo and the death of the excellent physician was death as a Hoben (means).
